ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron growled softly as Dinobot put more of his weight against her. His added weight added more pressure on her broken ribs, but she didn’t mind. Tavatron

Tavatron growled softly as Dinobot put more of his weight against her. His 
added weight added more pressure on her broken ribs, but she didn�t mind. 
Tavatron clenched her teeth and waited for him to regain his balance. She 
slowly searched the ark for any available �R chambers, when much to her 
surprise Dinobot loosened his grip on her shoulders until he was no longer 
using her for support.

Tavatron grimaced as Dinobot transformed. The sound of grinding gears and 
sparks sending shivers down her spine. However, once he was fully 
transformed he appeared to be alright, or at least in less pain. Tavatron 
sighed softly, bringing up a flickering image of her system�s status with 
her internal computer. Her optic lasers were non-existent and the majority 
of her right ribcage was either broken, cracked, or fractured. Her internal 
systems were fried, causing her optics to occasionally spark, not to mention 
a seriously fractured left wrist. Tavatron shut her optics, small sparks 
erupting from her eyes. she hadn�t realized she had sustained this much 
damage:

"Perhaps you are correct."

Tavatron opened her optics, expecting to see Dinobot heading for an �R 
chamber when much to her dismay she saw him drop in front of an open air 
vent. She hung her head and groaned softly. She didn�t know whether to kill 
him or feel sorry for him. On the one hand she had practicly dragged him to 
the base, ignoring her own injuries, just so he could get repaired. On the 
other hand she wasn�t very fond of CR chambers and suspected that neither 
was he. She crouched down beside him, she wanted to help, but didn�t know 
how. She wasn�t a medic �bot, she was a warrior. If anything she was more 
skilled at taking a life than saving it! Still, she had to do something:

"Beast mode."

Tavatron barely whispered the command, not wanting to disturb the sleeping 
Dinobot. She turned, about to head to her own quarters, then stopped 
mid-step. She looked back at him, watching a few moments as he shivered from 
some inner-cold. Tavatron snarled softly in frustration. She wanted to rest. 
She was exhausted, mentally and physically. Still... for some odd reason she 
just couldn�t leave. He needed warmth.  Tavatron walked over to him and 
placed a gentle paw on his shoulder. She could feel his body shiver beneath 
her padded paw. Silently she stepped closer, a little hesitant.

*Oh slag it!* She thought as she laid against him. She rested her head and 
forepaws across his back in an attempt to warm him. She knew he hated being 
touched, and if he were awake he would probably snap at her tell her to get 
the slag off of him, but she didn�t care. Like it or not she wasn�t moving. 
Tavatron closed her optics and fell into a deep, dreamless sleep. The warm 
air from the vent gently ruffling her fur as she slept.
